story.text: (Refiles to add Reuters Instrument Codes for companies' shares and to fix typo on "dossier" in fourth paragraph)PARIS Jan 2 (Reuters) - French stock market regulator AMF said on Tuesday it would rule within days on a stand-off between utility Suez LYOE.PA and billionaire entrepreneur Francois Pinault over whether he should be forced to declare his takeover intentions. Suez urged the AMF earlier on Tuesday to exert pressure on Pinault after he declined to rule out launching a takeover bid in the wake of media reports that he was planning to derail Suez's proposed 80 billion euro merger with Gaz de France GAZ.PA. "We are in contact with the players to clarify their positions," an AMF spokeswoman said. "The AMF college will publish its decision in the next few days after studying the dossier," she added. The college is the AMF's top decision-making body on mergers and acquisitions. The dispute between Suez and Pinault is seen as a test of new French rules requiring a potential predator to announce its bid intentions or forgo any action for 6 months.
story.title: refile - amf to rule on suez - pinault case in days
